member.name: IDiscRecorder2Ex.GetAdapterDescriptor
member.summary: Retrieves the adapter descriptor for the device.

param.name: data
param.para: Data buffer that contains the descriptor of the storage adapter. For details of the contents of the data buffer, see the STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR structure in the DDK
When done, call the CoTaskMemFree function to free the memory.

member.param: Size, in bytes, of the data buffer.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

member.name: IDiscRecorder2Ex.GetByteAlignmentMask
member.summary: Retrieves the byte alignment mask for the device.
member.param: Byte alignment mask that you use to determine if the buffer is aligned to the correct byte boundary for the device. The byte alignment value is always a number that is a power of 2.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

member.name: IDiscRecorder2Ex.GetDeviceDescriptor
member.summary: Retrieves the device descriptor for the device.

param.name: data
param.para: Data buffer that contains the descriptor of the storage device. For details of the contents of the data buffer, see the STORAGE_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR structure in the DDK
When done, call the CoTaskMemFree function to free the memory.

member.param: Size, in bytes, of the data buffer.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

member.name: IDiscRecorder2Ex.GetDiscInformation
member.summary: Retrieves the disc information from the media.

param.name: discInformation
param.para: Data buffer that contains disc information from the media. For details of the contents of the data buffer, see the READ DISC INFORMATION command in the latest revision of the MMC specification at ftp://ftp.t10.org/t10/drafts/mmc5.
When done, call the CoTaskMemFree function to free the memory.

member.param: Size, in bytes, of the data buffer.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.name: IDiscRecorder2Ex.GetFeaturePage
member.summary: Retrieves the specified feature page from the device.
member.param: Feature page to retrieve. For possible values, see the enumeration type.
Set to True to retrieve the feature page only when it is the current feature page. Otherwise, False to retrieve the feature page regardless of it being the current feature page.

param.name: featureData
param.para: Data buffer that contains the feature page. For details of the contents of the data buffer, see the GET CONFIGURATION command in the latest revision of the MMC specification at ftp://ftp.t10.org/t10/drafts/mmc5.
This method removes header information and other non-feature data before filling and sending this buffer.
When done, call the CoTaskMemFree function to free the memory.

member.param: Size, in bytes, of the featureData data buffer.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

The drive does not support the GET CONFIGURATION command.
Value: 0xC0AA020C

The feature page requested is not supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020A

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The feature page requested is supported, but is not marked as current.
Value: 0xC0AA020B

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.name: IDiscRecorder2Ex.GetMaximumNonPageAlignedTransferSize
member.summary: Retrieves the maximum non-page-aligned transfer size for the device.
member.param: Maximum size, in bytes, of a non-page-aligned buffer.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

member.name: IDiscRecorder2Ex.GetMaximumPageAlignedTransferSize
member.summary: Retrieves the maximum page-aligned transfer size for the device.
member.param: Maximum size, in bytes, of a page-aligned buffer.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

member.name: IDiscRecorder2Ex.GetModePage
member.summary: Retrieves the specified mode page from the device.
member.param: Mode page to retrieve. For possible values, see the enumeration type.
Type of mode page data to retrieve, for example, the current settings or the settings that are write enabled. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

param.name: modePageData
param.para: Data buffer that contains the mode page. For details of the contents of the data buffer, see the MODE SENSE (10) command in the latest revision of the MMC specification at ftp://ftp.t10.org/t10/drafts/mmc5.
This method removes header information and other non-page data before returning the buffer.
When done, call the CoTaskMemFree function to free the memory.

member.param: Size, in bytes, of the modePageData data buffer.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

member.name: IDiscRecorder2Ex.GetSupportedFeaturePages
member.summary: Retrieves the list of supported feature pages or the current feature pages of the device.
member.param: Set to True to retrieve only current feature pages. Otherwise, False to retrieve all feature pages that the device supports.

param.name: featureData
param.para: Data buffer that contains one or more feature page types. For possible values, see the enumeration type.
To get the feature page data associated with the feature page type, call the method.
When done, call the CoTaskMemFree function to free the memory.

member.param: Number of supported feature pages in the featureData data buffer.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

The drive does not support the GET CONFIGURATION command.
Value: 0xC0AA020C

The feature page requested is not supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020A

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The feature page requested is supported, but is not marked as current.
Value: 0xC0AA020B

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.name: IDiscRecorder2Ex.GetTrackInformation
member.summary: Retrieves the track information from the media.
member.param: Address field. The addressType parameter provides additional context for this parameter.
Type of address specified in the address parameter, for example, if this is an LBA address or a track number. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

param.name: trackInformation
param.para: Data buffer that contains the track information. For details of the contents of the data buffer, see the READ TRACK INFORMATION command in the latest revision of the MMC specification at ftp://ftp.t10.org/t10/drafts/mmc5.
When done, call the CoTaskMemFree function to free the memory.

member.param: Size, in bytes, of the trackInformation data buffer.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

Value: 0xC0AA020F

member.name: IDiscRecorder2Ex.ReadDvdStructure
member.summary: Reads a DVD structure from the media.

param.name: format
param.para: Format field of the command packet. Acceptable values range from zero to 0xFF.
param.div: Note This value is truncated to UCHAR.

member.param: Address field of the command packet.
Layer field of the command packet.
Authentication grant ID (AGID) field of the command packet.

param.name: data
param.para: Data buffer that contains the DVD structure. For details of the contents of the data buffer, see the READ DISC STRUCTURE command in the latest revision of the MMC specification at ftp://ftp.t10.org/t10/drafts/mmc5.
This method removes headers from the buffer.
When done, call the CoTaskMemFree function to free the memory.

member.param: Size, in bytes, of the data buffer.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

The drive does not support the GET CONFIGURATION command.
Value: 0xC0AA020C

The feature page requested is not supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020A

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The feature page requested is supported, but is not marked as current.
Value: 0xC0AA020B

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

member.name: IDiscRecorder2Ex.SendCommandGetDataFromDevice
member.summary: Sends a MMC command to the recording device requesting data from the device.
member.param: Command packet to send to the device.
Size, in bytes, of the command packet to send. Must be between 6 and 16 bytes.
Sense data returned by the recording device.
Time limit, in seconds, allowed for the send command to receive a result.
Application-allocated data buffer that will receive data associated with the send command. Must not be NULL.
Size, in bytes, of the Buffer data buffer. Must not be zero.
Size, in bytes, of the data returned in the Buffer data buffer.

returns.para: S_OK or one of the following values can be returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation:

listheader.description: Return code
Description
The device fails the command, but returns sense data.

returns.para: The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

The drive does not support the GET CONFIGURATION command.
Value: 0xC0AA020C

The feature page requested is not supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020A

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The feature page requested is supported, but is not marked as current.
Value: 0xC0AA020B

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.name: IDiscRecorder2Ex.SendCommandNoData
member.summary: Sends a MMC command to the recording device. Use this function when no data buffer is sent to nor received from the device.
member.param: Command packet to send to the device.
Size, in bytes, of the command packet to send. Must be between 6 and 16 bytes.
Sense data returned by the recording device.
Time limit, in seconds, allowed for the send command to receive a result.

returns.para: S_OK or one of the following values can be returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

The device fails the command, but returns sense data.
Value: 0x00AA0200

returns.para: The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code

member.name: IDiscRecorder2Ex.SendCommandSendDataToDevice
member.summary: Sends a MMC command and its associated data buffer to the recording device.
member.param: Command packet to send to the device.
Size, in bytes, of the command packet to send. Must be between 6 and 16 bytes.
Sense data returned by the recording device.
Time limit, in seconds, allowed for the send command to receive a result.
Buffer containing data associated with the send command. Must not be NULL.
Size, in bytes, of the data buffer to send. Must not be zero.

returns.para: S_OK or one of the following values can be returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

member.name: IDiscRecorder2Ex.SendDvdStructure
member.summary: Sends a DVD structure to the media.
member.param: Format field of the command packet. Acceptable values range from zero to 0xFF.
Data buffer that contains the DVD structure to send to the media. Do not include a header; this method generates and prepends a header to the DVD structure.
Size, in bytes, of the data buffer.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IDiscRecorder2Ex.SetModePage
member.summary: Sets the mode page data for the device.
member.param: Type of mode page data to send. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

param.name: data
param.para: Data buffer that contains the mode page data to send to the media. Do not include a header; this method generates and prepends a header to the mode page data.
For details on specifying the fields of the mode page data, see the MODE SELECT (10) command in the latest revision of the MMC specification at ftp://ftp.t10.org/t10/drafts/mmc5.

member.param: Size, in bytes, of the data buffer.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

summary.para: This interface represents a physical device. You use this interface to retrieve information about a CD and DVD device installed on the computer and to perform operations such as closing the tray or ejecting the media. This interface retrieves information not available through interface, and provides easier access to some of the same property values in IDiscRecorder2.
To get an instance of this interface, create an instance of the interface and then call the IDiscRecorder2.QueryInterface method to retrieve the IDiscRecorder2Ex interface.
Note that you cannot access this functionality from script.
